intro: Lobelia modesta, commonly known as the modest lobe, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, clustered blooms during the summer months. Lobelia modesta is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
